title: Soccer Field Awareness
description: Know your field! Boundaries, positions, and smart movement.

questions.question: What’s the name of the big box in front of your goal?
questions.explanation: The 18-yard box is where the goalie can use hands and where penalties happen.

questions.question: Where is the midfield line?
options: In the middle of the field
questions.explanation: It cuts the field in half and is where kickoffs happen.

questions.question: Why should you know where the sidelines are?
options: So you don’t run out of bounds
questions.explanation: Awareness of boundaries helps you stay in play and use space better.

questions.question: If you're a winger (wide player), where should you usually be?
questions.explanation: Wingers stretch the field and help spread the defense.

questions.question: The job of a center-back is mostly to:
options: Stand near the goalie and defend
questions.explanation: Center-backs protect the goal and organize the back line.

questions.question: A striker usually plays:
questions.explanation: Strikers are the players farthest forward trying to finish chances.

questions.question: Why is checking over your shoulder important?
questions.explanation: You can avoid pressure or find teammates by looking before the ball comes.

questions.question: What does 'switching the play' mean?
options: Moving the ball from one side to the other
questions.explanation: Switching spreads the defense and finds space on the opposite side.

questions.question: Why should defenders spread out when your team has the ball?
options: To stretch the other team and make passing easier
questions.explanation: Wide defenders help your team keep the ball and attack better.

questions.question: The 'final third' is:
options: The last part of your school day
The attacking part near the opponent’s goal
questions.explanation: It's where your team tries to create and finish chances.

questions.question: When you lose the ball, what should you do first?
questions.explanation: Reacting fast helps your team win the ball back.

questions.question: What's the benefit of staying wide on offense?
options: It pulls defenders away from the middle
questions.explanation: Width opens up space for passes and attacking runs.

questions.question: The halfway circle is used for:
questions.explanation: At kickoff, only one team can be inside the center circle.

questions.question: Which area should you defend the hardest?
options: The area in front of your own goal
questions.explanation: The zone in front of goal is the most dangerous to leave open.

questions.question: When you're in your own half, what's most important?
questions.explanation: Mistakes in your own half can lead to goals for the other team.
